comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Just going by the pic on the NSW Parliament web-site, I'd say this chap might be John Hubert Plunkett (1802-1869) - www.parliament.nsw.gov.au/prod/parlment/members.nsf/0/B19... The SLNSW have a couple of other portraits of him - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=154477 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=836982 Here's his ADB entry - adb.anu.edu.au/biography/plunkett-john-hubert-2556 I initially thought this might have been NSW Chief Justice Sir Alfred Stephen acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=899039 ...but on closer inspection I had to concede that the resemblance isn't really there (even if they're wearing similar rings)...then I stumbled across the pic of Plunkett.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] That has to be him! The likeness is so close. The only problem is that this image is attributed to Hall Photographic co, and Hall senior did not arrive in Australia until around 1874, several years after Plunkett's death. We may have to review the provenance of this one, it looks as though it is a photo of a photo. Thanks Quasymody, great find!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
